intro: Vochysia magna, commonly known as the giant velvet tree, is a large evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Chrysobalanoideae and is characterized by its thick, velvety leaves that give it its common name. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically yellow or greenish-yellow, followed by woody, spherical fruits. Vochysia magna is known for its ability to thrive in humid tropical climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural research.
